attributes.description:
Filter down traffic based on the region and API-Gateway the call has been processed. 
This needs to be configured upfront on the Filebeat reading the data from the API-Gateway.
attributes.title: [Axway] Region Gateway Selector

attributes.description: Showing the top 5 organizations owing the called APIs
attributes.title: [Axway] Top 5 API Organisations
[Axway] Top 10 Methods by # of Transactions

attributes.description:
This chart shows the status with which APIs were terminated. It is irrelevant in this chart whether the status was set by the API gateway or the backend system.
It thus provides a good overview of whether APIs can be successfully called from the consumer's perspective or not.
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Status

attributes.description:
This chart shows whether API requests successfully passed the API gateway or were blocked, for example due to missing authentication, security problems, quotas, etc.
If successfully passed APIs requests unexpectedly have a negative return code, such as 500, then it was returned by the backend system and not by the API gateway.
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Gateway status

attributes.description: Shows the top 20 API-Requests incl. security, custom policies and backend.
attributes.title: [Axway] Top 20 API-Requests

attributes.description: The top 10 API-Methods in the selected time-frame based on the given filters.
attributes.title: [Axway] Top 10 API Methods by Transactions

attributes.description: Monitor the status of your APIs. Status information, performance and appropriate filtering options.
attributes.title: [Axway] APIM Overview

attributes.description:
This graph shows the Instance System-CPU usage across all configured API-Gateways. 
To see System-CPU usage individually per API-Gateway it's important to set the configuration variable: GATEWAY_NAME
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Gateway CPU-Usage

attributes.description:
This graph shows the system memory usage across all configured API-Gateways. 
To see memory usage individually per API-Gateway it's important to set the configuration variable: GATEWAY_NAME
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Gateway Memory consumption
attributes.uiStateJSON: {"vis":{"colors":{"API-Gateway: Instance memory":"#0A437C","API-Gateway: System memory":"#B7DBAB","API-Gateway: Total memory":"#BF1B00"}}}

attributes.description: This graph shows the disc-usage across all configured API-Gateways. To see disc usage individually per API-Gateway it's important to set the configuration variable: GATEWAY_NAME
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Gateway Disk usage

attributes.description:
Shows the number of errors  during Logstash processing caused by API-Builder lookup errors. 
This may lead that API-Manager users cannot see their traffic as the events sent to Elasticsearch are not enriched properly
attributes.title: [Axway] Logstash lookup error

attributes.description:
Shows the number of errors  during Logstash processing caused by Memcache errors. 
Issues with Memcache may cause a performance degradation ingesting events into Elasticsearch.
attributes.title: [Axway] Logstash Memcache error
[Axway] More to come
attributes.visState: {"title":"[Axway] More to come","type":"markdown","aggs":[],"params":{"fontSize":12,"openLinksInNewTab":false,"markdown":"This an early version of this dashboard and there is more to come."}}

attributes.description:
Status information dashboard about API-Gateways. 
!!!! This dashboard will be improved later to add related information such as number of API-Calls, Applications, Users, etc.
